title: OpenType fonts with Greek polytonic (classical) characters
content:
Can anyone suggest some good OpenType fonts that are good for running text and have good latin _and_ classical greek character sets?

Some examples would be Adobe's [Minion Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20111228161929/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1719.html "Check out the font") and the new [Garamond Premier Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20111228161929/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/garamond/garamond.html "Visit Adobe's page about Adobe Garamond Premier Pro").
author: Peter G.

comments.content: Adobe Garamond Premeire Pro has gotten rave reviews concerning it's Greek characters and it includes polytonic Greek.
Palatino Linotype has the polytonic range inside it.

I just remembered, [Gentium](http://web.archive.org/web/20111228161929/http:/scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site_id=nrsi&id=gentium "Learn more about Gentium at sil.org") has a polytonic Greek character set. It's not OpenType, but it is **free**.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111228161929im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Gentium_sample_alpha.png)

And Gentium's Greek has forms gently varied depending  
on whether they're for mixing with Latin or stand-alone.

hhp

Peter, which specific OpenType features are you chasing?

Cheers, Si
Nothing in particular, Si, but old-style figures would be nice. Mostly, I just want to take advantage of the automatic ligatures with OpenType and Adobe CS products.
